item.title: Data-Driven ROPE Analysis
item.description: The Region of Practical Equivalence (ROPE) method is a fairly common approach to hypothesis testing, especially in Bayesian statistics. If itâ€™s new to you, Kruschke (2018) gives a good introduction. Here, we accept a null hypothesis if the credible interval of the relevant posterior distribution lies entirely within the ROPE. We reject a null hypothesis if the credible interval is entirely outside of the ROPE, and we remain undecided if there is partial overlap between the credible interval and the ROPE.
